vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man of the tribe of Judah living at the time of Israel before the Monarchy, first mentioned at Rut.4.17;
son of: Boaz (H1162) and Ruth (H7327);
father of: Jesse (H3448)
Also named: Ōbēd<\i> (Ὠβήδ "Obed" G5601)
§ Obed = "serving"
1) son of Boaz by Ruth and the grandfather of David
2) a Judaite, a descendant of Jarha, the Egyptian slave of Sheshan, in the line of Jerahmeel
3) a Judaite, father of Azariah, one of the captains of hundreds who joined with Jehoiada in the revolution by which Athaliah fell
4) one of David's mighty warriors
5) son of Shemaiah and a gatekeeper of the temple
vocabinfos._es_Definition: (a)   hijo de Booz; tribu de Judá; (b)   descendiente de Jerahmeel; tribu de Judá; (c)   guerrero, en tiempos del rey David; (d)   portero; en tiempos del rey David; (e)   padre de Azarías, oficial del ejército en los días de la reina Atalía
vocabinfos._zh_tw_Definition:
俄備得 这个陽性專有名詞在原文的意思是 "服事"
1) 波阿斯和路得的兒子, 大衛的祖父
2) 猶大人, 耶哈的子孫, 耶哈是示珊的埃及僕人,
示珊是耶拉篾的子孫
3) 猶大人, 亞撒利雅的父親, 亞撒利雅是參與耶何耶大率領使亞他利雅失敗的革命的領袖之一
4) 大衛的大能勇士之一 (代上11:47)
5) 示瑪雅的兒子, 聖殿的看門人 (代上26:7)
vocabinfos._zh_Definition:
俄备得 这个阳性专有名词在原文的意思是 "服事"
1) 波阿斯和路得的儿子, 大卫的祖父
2) 犹大人, 耶哈的子孙, 耶哈是示珊的埃及仆人,
示珊是耶拉篾的子孙
3) 犹大人, 亚撒利雅的父亲, 亚撒利雅是参与耶何耶大率领使亚他利雅失败的革命的领袖之一
4) 大卫的大能勇士之一 (代上11:47)
5) 示玛雅的儿子, 圣殿的看门人 (代上26:7)

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man of the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.2.37;
son of: Ephlal (H0654);
father of: Jehu (H3058I)
§ Obed = "serving"
1) son of Boaz by Ruth and the grandfather of David
2) a Judaite, a descendant of Jarha, the Egyptian slave of Sheshan, in the line of Jerahmeel
3) a Judaite, father of Azariah, one of the captains of hundreds who joined with Jehoiada in the revolution by which Athaliah fell
4) one of David's mighty warriors
5) son of Shemaiah and a gatekeeper of the temple

4) one of David's mighty warriors

son of: Shemaiah (H8098I);
brother of: Othni (H6273), Rephael (H7501), Elzabad (H0443H), Elihu (H0453I) and Semachiah (H5565)

3) a Judaite, father of Azariah, one of the captains of hundreds who joined with Jehoiada in the revolution by which Athaliah fell
4) one of David's mighty warriors
